byline.contributor: Laura Fauss contributed reporting from Berlin.
byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and ANDREW HIGGINS

abstract: European Union forges deal with Turkish government to stem disorganized and massive flow of migrants into bloc; agreement will give Turkey approximately $3.2 billion, a fast-track to visa-free travel for its citizens and additional enticements in exchange for separating war refugees from economic migrants and other duties.
lead_paragraph: European Union leaders met with Turkey’s prime minister on Sunday, promising aid and other inducements in exchange for Turkish action to clamp down on asylum seekers.

headline.main: E.U. Offers Turkey 3 Billion Euros to Stem Migrant Flow
headline.print_headline: E.U. Offers Turkey Over $3 Billion and Other Incentives to Stem Migrant Flow

snippet: European Union leaders met with Turkey’s prime minister on Sunday, promising aid and other inducements in exchange for Turkish action to clamp down on asylum seekers.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
